item.title: [GROOVY-1497] Problem using dot '.' operator to set string to null
item.description:
I've noticed that I can set a Date attribute to null using...

foo.date = null

...but the same thing does not seem to work for a String attribute...

foo.string = null // does not set foo.string to null

–

Here's a quick test case I used to verify this behavior.

I have a simple class with a String attribute and a Date attribute:

class Foo {
String string
Date date
}

And I have two tests for each attribute. One test uses the dot '.' operator and the assignment '=' operator to set the null value. The other test uses the classic setter method to assign the null value.

class FooTestCase extends GroovyTestCase {

void testAssignmentOperatorForStringAttribute()

{ Foo foo = new Foo() foo.string = "string" assertNotNull(foo.string) foo.string = null assertNull(foo.string) // fails here; assignment operator did not change value of foo.string }

void testAssignmentOperatorForDateAttribute()

{ Foo foo = new Foo() foo.date = new Date() assertNotNull(foo.date) foo.date = null assertNull(foo.date) }

void testSetterForStringAttribute()

{ Foo foo = new Foo() foo.string = "string" assertNotNull(foo.string) foo.setString(null) assertNull(foo.string) }

void testSetterForDateAttribute()

{ Foo foo = new Foo() foo.date = new Date() assertNotNull(foo.date) foo.setDate(null) assertNull(foo.date) }

}
